CareerCard.Title: Web Developer
CareerCard.Overview: A Web Developer is responsible for designing and maintaining websites and web applications. They work with programming languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create user-friendly interfaces and ensure that web applications are functional, responsive, and accessible. The role is significant as it directly impacts user experience and plays a crucial part in how businesses and organizations engage with their customers online.

Benefits: High demand for web development skills in the job market.
Potential for remote work and flexible hours.
Opportunity to work on creative and innovative projects.
Continuous learning and growth opportunities in technology.
Job Challenges: Can involve long hours, especially when meeting deadlines.
Need to stay updated with rapidly changing technologies and frameworks.
May experience isolated work conditions if working remotely.
Potentially repetitive tasks, especially in maintenance roles.

Dual Impact Highlights.Personal Growth: This career fosters personal growth through skill acquisition, creative problem-solving, and the opportunity to work on diverse projects that challenge one's abilities.
Dual Impact Highlights.Community Impact: Web Developers contribute to the community by creating accessible websites and applications that improve digital literacy and access to information, thereby enhancing overall community engagement.

Level1ScenarioCards.Title: Initial Challenge 1
Level1ScenarioCards.Description: As an entry-level Web Developer, you are tasked with fixing minor bugs in an existing web application. This challenge helps you learn how to navigate existing codebases and understand user feedback.

DecisionCards.Option A: Collaborate with a senior developer to understand the code and ask for guidance.

DecisionCards.Option B: Attempt to fix the bugs independently without asking for help.

Level2ScenarioCards.Title: Advanced Challenge 1
Level2ScenarioCards.Description: As your role expands, you are assigned to lead a small team in developing a new web application. This complex challenge requires project management skills alongside technical expertise.

DecisionCards.Option A: Implement Agile methodologies to ensure effective teamwork and project tracking.

DecisionCards.Option B: Assign tasks based solely on personal relationships rather than skills.
